intro: Ceraia calceola, commonly known as the little sandwort, is a small, flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often growing on rocky soils or in sandy habitats. Ceraia calceola is often found in Mediterranean climates and is considered a delicate, ornamental species in horticulture.
